question: It is true that conventional energy sources are mostly non-renewable.
It is false that solar energy is a type of conventional energy source.
Coal is a renewable energy source.
Hydropower is generated using the force of moving water.
Petroleum is refined to produce fuels such as diesel and petrol.
Wind energy is generated using wind turbines.
Biomass energy is derived from non-organic materials.
Nuclear energy is produced through the process of nuclear fission.
Tidal energy is produced using the movement of ocean tides.
Geothermal energy is generated from the heat inside the Earth.
